intro: Oreogrammitis locellata, commonly known as the small-leaf wall moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often curved and have a distinct costa. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocks or tree trunks. Its reproductive structures are borne on short, erect stalks, and it is often found in temperate regions. Oreogrammitis locellata plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
